SENTENCE.STRING: (4,221 m) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland.
The first ascent was by Leslie Stephen and Florence Crauford Grove with guides Jakob Anderegg and Melchior Anderegg on 22 August 1864 via the north ridge (AD).
Stephen wrote later that it was 'the nastiest piece of climbing I have ever accomplished'.

The normal route, the south-east ridge, was first climbed by the combined parties of Clinton Thomas Dent with guide AlexÂ­ander Burgener, and George Augustus Passingham, with guides Ferdinand Imseng and Franz Andermatten on 5 September 1872.
The first winter and ski ascent was by Marcel Kurz and T. Theytaz on 7 February 1914.
